text: A data organization leader is upset about the data analysis team’s reports being different from the data engineering team’s reports. The leader believes the siloed nature of their organization’s data engineering and data analysis architectures is to blame. Which of the following describes how a data lakehouse could alleviate this issue?

options.label: A
options.text: Both teams would autoscale their work as data size evolves

options.label: B
options.text: Both teams would use the same source of truth for their work

options.label: C
options.text: Both teams would reorganize to report to the same department

options.label: D
options.text: Both teams would be able to collaborate on projects in real-time

options.label: E
options.text: Both teams would respond more quickly to ad-hoc requests

text: Which of the following describes a scenario in which a data team will want to utilize cluster pools?

options.label: A
options.text: An automated report needs to be refreshed as quickly as possible.

options.label: B
options.text: An automated report needs to be made reproducible.

options.label: C
options.text: An automated report needs to be tested to identify errors.

options.label: D
options.text: An automated report needs to be version-controlled across multiple collaborators.

options.label: E
options.text: An automated report needs to be runnable by all stakeholders.

text: Which of the following is hosted completely in the control plane of the classic Databricks architecture?

options.label: A
options.text: Worker node

options.label: B
options.text: JDBC data source

options.label: C
options.text: Databricks web application

options.label: D
options.text: Databricks Filesystem

options.label: E
options.text: Driver node

text: Which of the following bene�ts of using the Databricks Lakehouse Platform is provided by Delta Lake?

options.label: A
options.text: The ability to manipulate the same data using a variety of languages

options.label: B
options.text: The ability to collaborate in real time on a single notebook

options.label: C
options.text: The ability to set up alerts for query failures

options.label: D
options.text: The ability to support batch and streaming workloads

options.label: E
options.text: The ability to distribute complex data operations

text: Which of the following describes the storage organization of a Delta table?

options.label: A
options.text: Delta tables are stored in a single �le that contains data, history, metadata, and other attributes.

options.label: B
options.text: Delta tables store their data in a single �le and all metadata in a collection of �les in a separate location.

options.label: C
options.text: Delta tables are stored in a collection of �les that contain data, history, metadata, and other attributes.

options.label: D
options.text: Delta tables are stored in a collection of �les that contain only the data stored within the table.

options.label: E
options.text: Delta tables are stored in a single �le that contains only the data stored within the table.

text: Which of the following code blocks will remove the rows where the value in column age is greater than 25 from the existing Delta table my_table and save the updated table?

options.label: A
options.text: SELECT * FROM my_table WHERE age > 25;

options.label: B
options.text: UPDATE my_table WHERE age > 25;

options.label: C
options.text: DELETE FROM my_table WHERE age > 25;

options.label: D
options.text: UPDATE my_table WHERE age <= 25;

options.label: E
options.text: DELETE FROM my_table WHERE age <= 25;

text: A data engineer has realized that they made a mistake when making a daily update to a table. They need to use Delta time travel to restore the table to a version that is 3 days old. However, when the data engineer attempts to time travel to the older version, they are unable to restore the data because the data �les have been deleted. Which of the following explains why the data �les are no longer present?

options.label: A
options.text: The VACUUM command was run on the table

options.label: B
options.text: The TIME TRAVEL command was run on the table

options.label: C
options.text: The DELETE HISTORY command was run on the table

options.label: D
options.text: The OPTIMIZE command was nun on the table

options.label: E
options.text: The HISTORY command was run on the table

text: Which of the following Git operations must be performed outside of Databricks Repos?

options.text: Commit

options.label: B
options.text: Pull

options.label: C
options.text: Push

options.label: D

options.label: E

text: Which of the following data lakehouse features results in improved data quality over a traditional data lake?

options.label: A
options.text: A data lakehouse provides storage solutions for structured and unstructured data.

options.label: B
options.text: A data lakehouse supports ACID-compliant transactions.

options.label: C
options.text: A data lakehouse allows the use of SQL queries to examine data.

options.label: D
options.text: A data lakehouse stores data in open formats.

options.label: E
options.text: A data lakehouse enables machine learning and arti�cial Intelligence workloads.

text: A data engineer needs to determine whether to use the built-in Databricks Notebooks versioning or version their project using Databricks Repos. Which of the following is an advantage of using Databricks Repos over the Databricks Notebooks versioning?

options.label: A
options.text: Databricks Repos automatically saves development progress

options.label: B
options.text: Databricks Repos supports the use of multiple branches

options.label: C
options.text: Databricks Repos allows users to revert to previous versions of a notebook

options.label: D
options.text: Databricks Repos provides the ability to comment on speci�c changes

options.label: E
options.text: Databricks Repos is wholly housed within the Databricks Lakehouse Platform

text: A data engineer has left the organization. The data team needs to transfer ownership of the data engineer’s Delta tables to a new data engineer. The new data engineer is the lead engineer on the data team. Assuming the original data engineer no longer has access, which of the following individuals must be the one to transfer ownership of the Delta tables in Data Explorer?

options.label: A
options.text: Databricks account representative

options.label: B
options.text: This transfer is not possible

options.label: C
options.text: Workspace administrator

options.label: D
options.text: New lead data engineer

options.label: E
options.text: Original data engineer

text: A data analyst has created a Delta table sales that is used by the entire data analysis team. They want help from the data engineering team to implement a series of tests to ensure the data is clean. However, the data engineering team uses Python for its tests rather than SQL. Which of the following commands could the data engineering team use to access sales in PySpark?

options.label: A
options.text: SELECT * FROM sales

options.label: B
options.text: There is no way to share data between PySpark and SQL.

options.label: C
options.text: spark.sql("sales")D. spark.delta.table("sales")

options.label: E
options.text: spark.table("sales")

text: Which of the following commands will return the location of database customer360?

options.label: A
options.text: DESCRIBE LOCATION customer360;

options.label: B
options.text: DROP DATABASE customer360;

options.label: C
options.text: DESCRIBE DATABASE customer360;

options.label: D
options.text: ALTER DATABASE customer360 SET DBPROPERTIES ('location' = '/user'};

options.label: E
options.text: USE DATABASE customer360;

text: A data engineer wants to create a new table containing the names of customers that live in France. They have written the following command: A senior data engineer mentions that it is organization policy to include a table property indicating that the new table includes personally identi�able information (PII). Which of the following lines of code �lls in the above blank to successfully complete the task?

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: TBLPROPERTIES PII

options.label: D

text: Which of the following bene�ts is provided by the array functions from Spark SQL?

options.label: A
options.text: An ability to work with data in a variety of types at once

options.label: B
options.text: An ability to work with data within certain partitions and windows

options.label: C

options.label: D

text: Which of the following commands can be used to write data into a Delta table while avoiding the writing of duplicate records?

options.label: B

text: A data analyst has a series of queries in a SQL program. The data analyst wants this program to run every day. They only want the �nal query in the program to run on Sundays. They ask for help from the data engineering team to complete this task. Which of the following approaches could be used by the data engineering team to complete this task?

options.label: A
options.text: They could submit a feature request with Databricks to add this functionality.

options.label: B
options.text: They could wrap the queries using PySpark and use Python’s control �ow system to determine when to run the �nal query.

options.label: C
options.text: They could only run the entire program on Sundays.

options.label: D
options.text: They could automatically restrict access to the source table in the �nal query so that it is only accessible on Sundays.

options.label: E
options.text: They could redesign the data model to separate the data used in the �nal query into a new table.

text: A data engineer runs a statement every day to copy the previous day’s sales into the table transactions. Each day’s sales are in their own �le in the location "/transactions/raw". Today, the data engineer runs the following command to complete this task: After running the command today, the data engineer notices that the number of records in table transactions has not changed. Which of the following describes why the statement might not have copied any new records into the table?

options.label: A
options.text: The format of the �les to be copied were not included with the FORMAT_OPTIONS keyword.

options.label: B
options.text: The names of the �les to be copied were not included with the FILES keyword.

options.label: C
options.text: The previous day’s �le has already been copied into the table.

options.label: D
options.text: The PARQUET �le format does not support COPY INTO.

options.label: E
options.text: The COPY INTO statement requires the table to be refreshed to view the copied rows.

text: A data engineer needs to create a table in Databricks using data from their organization’s existing SQLite database. They run the following command: Which of the following lines of code �lls in the above blank to successfully complete the task?

options.label: A
options.text: org.apache.spark.sql.jdbc

options.label: B
options.text: autoloader

options.label: C
options.text: DELTA

options.label: D
options.text: sqlite

options.label: E
options.text: org.apache.spark.sql.sqlite

text: A data engineering team has two tables. The �rst table march_transactions is a collection of all retail transactions in the month of March. The second table april_transactions is a collection of all retail transactions in the month of April. There are no duplicate records between the tables. Which of the following commands should be run to create a new table all_transactions that contains all records from march_transactions and april_transactions without duplicate records?

options.label: A
options.text: CREATE TABLE all_transactions AS SELECT * FROM march_transactions INNER JOIN SELECT * FROM april_transactions;

options.label: B
options.text: CREATE TABLE all_transactions AS SELECT * FROM march_transactions UNION SELECT * FROM april_transactions;

options.label: C
options.text: CREATE TABLE all_transactions AS SELECT * FROM march_transactions OUTER JOIN SELECT * FROM april_transactions;

options.label: D
options.text: CREATE TABLE all_transactions AS SELECT * FROM march_transactions INTERSECT SELECT * from april_transactions;

options.label: E
options.text: CREATE TABLE all_transactions AS SELECT * FROM march_transactions MERGE SELECT * FROM april_transactions;

text: A data engineer only wants to execute the �nal block of a Python program if the Python variable day_of_week is equal to 1 and the Python variable review_period is True. Which of the following control �ow statements should the data engineer use to begin this conditionally executed code block?

options.label: A
options.text: if day_of_week = 1 and review_period:

options.label: B
options.text: if day_of_week = 1 and review_period = "True":

options.label: C
options.text: if day_of_week == 1 and review_period == "True":

options.label: D
options.text: if day_of_week == 1 and review_period:

options.label: E
options.text: if day_of_week = 1 & review_period: = "True":

text: A data engineer is attempting to drop a Spark SQL table my_table. The data engineer wants to delete all table metadata and data. They run the following command: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS my_table - While the object no longer appears when they run SHOW TABLES, the data �les still exist. Which of the following describes why the data �les still exist and the metadata �les were deleted?

options.label: A
options.text: The table’s data was larger than 10 GB

options.label: B
options.text: The table’s data was smaller than 10 GB

options.label: C
options.text: The table was external

options.label: D
options.text: The table did not have a location

options.label: E
options.text: The table was managed

text: A data engineer wants to create a data entity from a couple of tables. The data entity must be used by other data engineers in other sessions. It also must be saved to a physical location. Which of the following data entities should the data engineer create?

options.label: A
options.text: Database

options.label: B
options.text: Function

options.label: C
options.text: View

options.label: D

options.label: E
options.text: Table

text: A data engineer is maintaining a data pipeline. Upon data ingestion, the data engineer notices that the source data is starting to have a lower level of quality. The data engineer would like to automate the process of monitoring the quality level. Which of the following tools can the data engineer use to solve this problem?

options.label: A
options.text: Unity Catalog

options.label: B
options.text: Data Explorer

options.label: C
options.text: Delta Lake

options.label: D
options.text: Delta Live Tables

options.label: E
options.text: Auto Loader

text: A Delta Live Table pipeline includes two datasets de�ned using STREAMING LIVE TABLE. Three datasets are de�ned against Delta Lake table sources using LIVE TABLE. The table is con�gured to run in Production mode using the Continuous Pipeline Mode. Assuming previously unprocessed data exists and all de�nitions are valid, what is the expected outcome after clicking Start to update the pipeline?

options.label: A
options.text: All datasets will be updated at set intervals until the pipeline is shut down. The compute resources will persist to allow for additional testing.

options.label: B
options.text: All datasets will be updated once and the pipeline will persist without any processing. The compute resources will persist but go unused.

options.label: C
options.text: All datasets will be updated at set intervals until the pipeline is shut down. The compute resources will be deployed for the update and terminated when the pipeline is stopped.

options.label: D
options.text: All datasets will be updated once and the pipeline will shut down. The compute resources will be terminated.

options.label: E
options.text: All datasets will be updated once and the pipeline will shut down. The compute resources will persist to allow for additional testing.

text: In order for Structured Streaming to reliably track the exact progress of the processing so that it can handle any kind of failure by restarting and/or reprocessing, which of the following two approaches is used by Spark to record the offset range of the data being processed in each trigger?

options.label: A
options.text: Checkpointing and Write-ahead Logs

options.label: B
options.text: Structured Streaming cannot record the offset range of the data being processed in each trigger.

options.label: C
options.text: Replayable Sources and Idempotent Sinks

options.label: D
options.text: Write-ahead Logs and Idempotent Sinks

options.label: E
options.text: Checkpointing and Idempotent Sinks

text: Which of the following describes the relationship between Gold tables and Silver tables?

options.label: A
options.text: Gold tables are more likely to contain aggregations than Silver tables.

options.label: B
options.text: Gold tables are more likely to contain valuable data than Silver tables.

options.label: C
options.text: Gold tables are more likely to contain a less re�ned view of data than Silver tables.

options.label: D
options.text: Gold tables are more likely to contain more data than Silver tables.

options.label: E
options.text: Gold tables are more likely to contain truthful data than Silver tables.

text: Which of the following describes the relationship between Bronze tables and raw data?

options.label: A
options.text: Bronze tables contain less data than raw data �les.

options.label: B
options.text: Bronze tables contain more truthful data than raw data.

options.label: C
options.text: Bronze tables contain aggregates while raw data is unaggregated.

options.label: D
options.text: Bronze tables contain a less re�ned view of data than raw data.

options.label: E
options.text: Bronze tables contain raw data with a schema applied.

text: Which of the following tools is used by Auto Loader process data incrementally?

options.label: A
options.text: Checkpointing

options.label: B
options.text: Spark Structured Streaming

options.label: C
options.text: Data Explorer

options.label: D
options.text: Unity Catalog

options.label: E
options.text: Databricks SQL

text: A data engineer has con�gured a Structured Streaming job to read from a table, manipulate the data, and then perform a streaming write into a new table. The cade block used by the data engineer is below: If the data engineer only wants the query to execute a micro-batch to process data every 5 seconds, which of the following lines of code should the data engineer use to �ll in the blank?

options.label: A
options.text: trigger("5 seconds")

options.label: B
options.text: trigger()

options.label: C
options.text: trigger(once="5 seconds")

options.label: D
options.text: trigger(processingTime="5 seconds")

options.label: E
options.text: trigger(continuous="5 seconds")

text: A dataset has been de�ned using Delta Live Tables and includes an expectations clause: CONSTRAINT valid_timestamp EXPECT (timestamp > '2020-01-01') ON VIOLATION DROP ROW What is the expected behavior when a batch of data containing data that violates these constraints is processed?

options.label: A
options.text: Records that violate the expectation are dropped from the target dataset and loaded into a quarantine table.

options.label: B
options.text: Records that violate the expectation are added to the target dataset and �agged as invalid in a �eld added to the target dataset.

options.label: C
options.text: Records that violate the expectation are dropped from the target dataset and recorded as invalid in the event log.

options.label: D
options.text: Records that violate the expectation are added to the target dataset and recorded as invalid in the event log.

options.label: E
options.text: Records that violate the expectation cause the job to fail.

text: Which of the following describes when to use the CREATE STREAMING LIVE TABLE (formerly CREATE INCREMENTAL LIVE TABLE) syntax over the CREATE LIVE TABLE syntax when creating Delta Live Tables (DLT) tables using SQL?

options.label: A
options.text: CREATE STREAMING LIVE TABLE should be used when the subsequent step in the DLT pipeline is static.

options.label: B
options.text: CREATE STREAMING LIVE TABLE should be used when data needs to be processed incrementally.

options.label: C
options.text: CREATE STREAMING LIVE TABLE is redundant for DLT and it does not need to be used.

options.label: D
options.text: CREATE STREAMING LIVE TABLE should be used when data needs to be processed through complicated aggregations.

options.label: E
options.text: CREATE STREAMING LIVE TABLE should be used when the previous step in the DLT pipeline is static.

text: A data engineer is designing a data pipeline. The source system generates �les in a shared directory that is also used by other processes. As a result, the �les should be kept as is and will accumulate in the directory. The data engineer needs to identify which �les are new since the previous run in the pipeline, and set up the pipeline to only ingest those new �les with each run. Which of the following tools can the data engineer use to solve this problem?

options.label: A
options.text: Unity Catalog

options.label: B
options.text: Delta Lake

options.label: C
options.text: Databricks SQL

options.label: D
options.text: Data Explorer

options.label: E
options.text: Auto Loader

text: A data engineer has three tables in a Delta Live Tables (DLT) pipeline. They have con�gured the pipeline to drop invalid records at each table. They notice that some data is being dropped due to quality concerns at some point in the DLT pipeline. They would like to determine at which table in their pipeline the data is being dropped. Which of the following approaches can the data engineer take to identify the table that is dropping the records?

options.label: A
options.text: They can set up separate expectations for each table when developing their DLT pipeline.

options.label: B
options.text: They cannot determine which table is dropping the records.

options.label: C
options.text: They can set up DLT to notify them via email when records are dropped.

options.label: D
options.text: They can navigate to the DLT pipeline page, click on each table, and view the data quality statistics.

options.label: E
options.text: They can navigate to the DLT pipeline page, click on the “Error” button, and review the present errors.

text: A data engineer has a single-task Job that runs each morning before they begin working. After identifying an upstream data issue, they need to set up another task to run a new notebook prior to the original task. Which of the following approaches can the data engineer use to set up the new task?

options.label: A
options.text: They can clone the existing task in the existing Job and update it to run the new notebook.

options.label: B
options.text: They can create a new task in the existing Job and then add it as a dependency of the original task.

options.label: C
options.text: They can create a new task in the existing Job and then add the original task as a dependency of the new task.

options.label: D
options.text: They can create a new job from scratch and add both tasks to run concurrently.

options.label: E
options.text: They can clone the existing task to a new Job and then edit it to run the new notebook.

text: An engineering manager wants to monitor the performance of a recent project using a Databricks SQL query. For the �rst week following the project’s release, the manager wants the query results to be updated every minute. However, the manager is concerned that the compute resources used for the query will be left running and cost the organization a lot of money beyond the �rst week of the project’s release. Which of the following approaches can the engineering team use to ensure the query does not cost the organization any money beyond the �rst week of the project’s release?

options.label: A
options.text: They can set a limit to the number of DBUs that are consumed by the SQL Endpoint.

options.label: B
options.text: They can set the query’s refresh schedule to end after a certain number of refreshes.

options.label: C
options.text: They cannot ensure the query does not cost the organization money beyond the �rst week of the project’s release.

options.label: D
options.text: They can set a limit to the number of individuals that are able to manage the query’s refresh schedule.

options.label: E
options.text: They can set the query’s refresh schedule to end on a certain date in the query scheduler.

text: A data analysis team has noticed that their Databricks SQL queries are running too slowly when connected to their always-on SQL endpoint. They claim that this issue is present when many members of the team are running small queries simultaneously. They ask the data engineering team for help. The data engineering team notices that each of the team’s queries uses the same SQL endpoint. Which of the following approaches can the data engineering team use to improve the latency of the team’s queries?

options.label: A
options.text: They can increase the cluster size of the SQL endpoint.

options.label: B
options.text: They can increase the maximum bound of the SQL endpoint’s scaling range.

options.label: C
options.text: They can turn on the Auto Stop feature for the SQL endpoint.

options.label: D
options.text: They can turn on the Serverless feature for the SQL endpoint.

options.label: E
options.text: They can turn on the Serverless feature for the SQL endpoint and change the Spot Instance Policy to “Reliability Optimized.”

text: A data engineer wants to schedule their Databricks SQL dashboard to refresh once per day, but they only want the associated SQL endpoint to be running when it is necessary. Which of the following approaches can the data engineer use to minimize the total running time of the SQL endpoint used in the refresh schedule of their dashboard?

options.label: A
options.text: They can ensure the dashboard’s SQL endpoint matches each of the queries’ SQL endpoints.

options.label: B
options.text: They can set up the dashboard’s SQL endpoint to be serverless.

options.label: C
options.text: They can turn on the Auto Stop feature for the SQL endpoint.

options.label: D
options.text: They can reduce the cluster size of the SQL endpoint.

options.label: E
options.text: They can ensure the dashboard’s SQL endpoint is not one of the included query’s SQL endpoint.

text: A data engineer has been using a Databricks SQL dashboard to monitor the cleanliness of the input data to an ELT job. The ELT job has its Databricks SQL query that returns the number of input records containing unexpected NULL values. The data engineer wants their entire team to be noti�ed via a messaging webhook whenever this value reaches 100. Which of the following approaches can the data engineer use to notify their entire team via a messaging webhook whenever the number of NULL values reaches 100?

options.label: A
options.text: They can set up an Alert with a custom template.

options.label: B
options.text: They can set up an Alert with a new email alert destination.

options.label: C
options.text: They can set up an Alert with a new webhook alert destination.

options.label: D
options.text: They can set up an Alert with one-time noti�cations.

options.label: E
options.text: They can set up an Alert without noti�cations.

text: A single Job runs two notebooks as two separate tasks. A data engineer has noticed that one of the notebooks is running slowly in the Job’s current run. The data engineer asks a tech lead for help in identifying why this might be the case. Which of the following approaches can the tech lead use to identify why the notebook is running slowly as part of the Job?

options.label: A
options.text: They can navigate to the Runs tab in the Jobs UI to immediately review the processing notebook.

options.label: B
options.text: They can navigate to the Tasks tab in the Jobs UI and click on the active run to review the processing notebook.

options.label: C
options.text: They can navigate to the Runs tab in the Jobs UI and click on the active run to review the processing notebook.

options.label: D
options.text: There is no way to determine why a Job task is running slowly.

options.label: E
options.text: They can navigate to the Tasks tab in the Jobs UI to immediately review the processing notebook.

text: A data engineer has a Job with multiple tasks that runs nightly. Each of the tasks runs slowly because the clusters take a long time to start. Which of the following actions can the data engineer perform to improve the start up time for the clusters used for the Job?

options.label: A
options.text: They can use endpoints available in Databricks SQL

options.label: B
options.text: They can use jobs clusters instead of all-purpose clusters

options.label: C
options.text: They can con�gure the clusters to be single-node

options.label: D
options.text: They can use clusters that are from a cluster pool

options.label: E
options.text: They can con�gure the clusters to autoscale for larger data sizes

text: A new data engineering team team. has been assigned to an ELT project. The new data engineering team will need full privileges on the database customers to fully manage the project. Which of the following commands can be used to grant full permissions on the database to the new data engineering team?

options.label: A
options.text: GRANT USAGE ON DATABASE customers TO team;

options.label: B
options.text: GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON DATABASE team TO customers;

options.label: C
options.text: GRANT SELECT PRIVILEGES ON DATABASE customers TO teams;

options.label: D
options.text: GRANT SELECT CREATE MODIFY USAGE PRIVILEGES ON DATABASE customers TO team;

options.label: E
options.text: GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON DATABASE customers TO team;

text: A new data engineering team has been assigned to work on a project. The team will need access to database customers in order to see what tables already exist. The team has its own group team. Which of the following commands can be used to grant the necessary permission on the entire database to the new team?

options.label: A
options.text: GRANT VIEW ON CATALOG customers TO team;

options.label: B
options.text: GRANT CREATE ON DATABASE customers TO team;

options.label: C
options.text: GRANT USAGE ON CATALOG team TO customers;

options.label: D
options.text: GRANT CREATE ON DATABASE team TO customers;

options.label: E
options.text: GRANT USAGE ON DATABASE customers TO team;

text: A data engineer is running code in a Databricks Repo that is cloned from a central Git repository. text: A Delta Live Table pipeline includes two datasets de�ned using STREAMING LIVE TABLE. Three datasets are de�ned against Delta Lake table sources using LIVE TABLE. options.label: A

text: A dataset has been de�ned using Delta Live Tables and includes an expectations clause: CONSTRAINT valid_timestamp EXPECT (timestamp > '2020-01-01') ON VIOLATION FAIL UPDATE What is the expected behavior when a batch of data containing data that violates these constraints is processed?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Records that violate the expectation cause the job to fail.

options.label: C
options.text: Records that violate the expectation are dropped from the target dataset and loaded into a quarantine table.

options.label: D
options.text: Records that violate the expectation are added to the target dataset and recorded as invalid in the event log.

options.label: E
options.text: Records that violate the expectation are added to the target dataset and �agged as invalid in a �eld added to the target dataset.

text: A data engineering team has noticed that their Databricks SQL queries are running too slowly when they are submitted to a non-running SQL endpoint. text: A data engineer wants to schedule their Databricks SQL dashboard to refresh every hour, but they only want the associated SQL endpoint to be running when it is necessary. options.label: D

text: A data engineer has realized that the data �les associated with a Delta table are incredibly small. They want to compact the small �les to form larger �les to improve performance. Which keyword can be used to compact the small �les?

text: A data engineer runs a statement every day to copy the previous day’s sales into the table transactions. Each day’s sales are in their own �le in the location "/transactions/raw". text: A data engineer has con�gured a Structured Streaming job to read from a table, manipulate the data, and then perform a streaming write into a new table. The code block used by the data engineer is below: Which line of code should the data engineer use to �ll in the blank if the data engineer only wants the query to execute a micro-batch to process data every 5 seconds?

text: A data engineer has three tables in a Delta Live Tables (DLT) pipeline. They have con�gured the pipeline to drop invalid records at each table. They notice that some data is being dropped due to quality concerns at some point in the DLT pipeline. They would like to determine at which table in their pipeline the data is being dropped. Which approach can the data engineer take to identify the table that is dropping the records?

options.label: A
options.text: They can set up separate expectations for each table when developing their DLT pipeline.

options.label: B
options.text: They can navigate to the DLT pipeline page, click on the “Error” button, and review the present errors.

options.label: C
options.text: They can set up DLT to notify them via email when records are dropped.

options.label: D
options.text: They can navigate to the DLT pipeline page, click on each table, and view the data quality statistics.

text: What is used by Spark to record the offset range of the data being processed in each trigger in order for Structured Streaming to reliably track the exact progress of the processing so that it can handle any kind of failure by restarting and/or reprocessing?

options.label: A
options.text: Checkpointing and Write-ahead Logs

options.label: B
options.text: Replayable Sources and Idempotent Sinks

options.label: C
options.text: Write-ahead Logs and Idempotent Sinks

options.label: D
options.text: Checkpointing and Idempotent Sinks

text: What describes the relationship between Gold tables and Silver tables?

options.label: A
options.text: Gold tables are more likely to contain aggregations than Silver tables.

options.label: B
options.text: Gold tables are more likely to contain valuable data than Silver tables.

options.label: C
options.text: Gold tables are more likely to contain a less re�ned view of data than Silver tables.

options.label: D
options.text: Gold tables are more likely to contain truthful data than Silver tables.

text: What describes when to use the CREATE STREAMING LIVE TABLE (formerly CREATE INCREMENTAL LIVE TABLE) syntax over the CREATE LIVE TABLE syntax when creating Delta Live Tables (DLT) tables using SQL?

options.label: A
options.text: CREATE STREAMING LIVE TABLE should be used when the subsequent step in the DLT pipeline is static.

options.label: B
options.text: CREATE STREAMING LIVE TABLE should be used when data needs to be processed incrementally.

options.label: C
options.text: CREATE STREAMING LIVE TABLE should be used when data needs to be processed through complicated aggregations.

options.label: D
options.text: CREATE STREAMING LIVE TABLE should be used when the previous step in the DLT pipeline is static.

text: A Delta Live Table pipeline includes two datasets de�ned using STREAMING LIVE TABLE. Three datasets are de�ned against Delta Lake table sources using LIVE TABLE. The table is con�gured to run in Production mode using the Continuous Pipeline Mode. What is the expected outcome after clicking Start to update the pipeline assuming previously unprocessed data exists and all de�nitions are valid?

options.label: A
options.text: All datasets will be updated at set intervals until the pipeline is shut down. The compute resources will persist to allow for additional testing.

options.label: B
options.text: All datasets will be updated once and the pipeline will shut down. The compute resources will persist to allow for additional testing.

options.label: C
options.text: All datasets will be updated at set intervals until the pipeline is shut down. The compute resources will be deployed for the update and terminated when the pipeline is stopped.

options.label: D
options.text: All datasets will be updated once and the pipeline will shut down. The compute resources will be terminated.

text: Which type of workloads are compatible with Auto Loader?

options.label: A
options.text: Streaming workloads

options.label: B
options.text: Machine learning workloads

options.label: C
options.text: Serverless workloads

options.label: D
options.text: Batch workloads

text: A data engineer has developed a data pipeline to ingest data from a JSON source using Auto Loader, but the engineer has not provided any type inference or schema hints in their pipeline. Upon reviewing the data, the data engineer has noticed that all of the columns in the target table are of the string type despite some of the �elds only including �oat or boolean values. Why has Auto Loader inferred all of the columns to be of the string type?

options.label: A
options.text: Auto Loader cannot infer the schema of ingested data

options.label: B
options.text: JSON data is a text-based format

options.label: C
options.text: Auto Loader only works with string data

options.label: D
options.text: All of the �elds had at least one null value

text: Which statement regarding the relationship between Silver tables and Bronze tables is always true?

options.label: A
options.text: Silver tables contain a less re�ned, less clean view of data than Bronze data.

options.label: B
options.text: Silver tables contain aggregates while Bronze data is unaggregated.

options.label: C
options.text: Silver tables contain more data than Bronze tables.

options.label: D
options.text: Silver tables contain less data than Bronze tables.

text: A dataset has been de�ned using Delta Live Tables and includes an expectations clause: CONSTRAINT valid_timestamp EXPECT (timestamp > '2020-01-01') ON VIOLATION DROP ROW What is the expected behavior when a batch of data containing data that violates these constraints is processed?

options.label: A
options.text: Records that violate the expectation cause the job to fail.

options.label: B
options.text: Records that violate the expectation are added to the target dataset and �agged as invalid in a �eld added to the target dataset.

options.label: C
options.text: Records that violate the expectation are dropped from the target dataset and recorded as invalid in the event log.

options.label: D
options.text: Records that violate the expectation are added to the target dataset and recorded as invalid in the event log.

text: A data engineer has a Job with multiple tasks that runs nightly. Each of the tasks runs slowly because the clusters take a long time to start. Which action can the data engineer perform to improve the start up time for the clusters used for the Job?

options.label: A
options.text: They can use endpoints available in Databricks SQL

options.label: B
options.text: They can use jobs clusters instead of all-purpose clusters

options.label: C
options.text: They can con�gure the clusters to autoscale for larger data sizes

options.label: D
options.text: They can use clusters that are from a cluster pool

text: A data engineer has a single-task Job that runs each morning before they begin working. After identifying an upstream data issue, they need to set up another task to run a new notebook prior to the original task. Which approach can the data engineer use to set up the new task?

options.label: A
options.text: They can clone the existing task in the existing Job and update it to run the new notebook.

options.label: B
options.text: They can create a new task in the existing Job and then add it as a dependency of the original task.

options.label: C
options.text: They can create a new task in the existing Job and then add the original task as a dependency of the new task.

options.label: D
options.text: They can create a new job from scratch and add both tasks to run concurrently.

text: A single Job runs two notebooks as two separate tasks. A data engineer has noticed that one of the notebooks is running slowly in the Job’s current run. The data engineer asks a tech lead for help in identifying why this might be the case. Which approach can the tech lead use to identify why the notebook is running slowly as part of the Job?

options.label: A
options.text: They can navigate to the Runs tab in the Jobs UI to immediately review the processing notebook.

options.label: B
options.text: They can navigate to the Tasks tab in the Jobs UI and click on the active run to review the processing notebook.

options.label: C
options.text: They can navigate to the Runs tab in the Jobs UI and click on the active run to review the processing notebook.

options.label: D
options.text: They can navigate to the Tasks tab in the Jobs UI to immediately review the processing notebook.

text: A data analysis team has noticed that their Databricks SQL queries are running too slowly when connected to their always-on SQL endpoint. They claim that this issue is present when many members of the team are running small queries simultaneously. They ask the data engineering team for help. The data engineering team notices that each of the team’s queries uses the same SQL endpoint. Which approach can the data engineering team use to improve the latency of the team’s queries?

options.label: A
options.text: They can increase the cluster size of the SQL endpoint.

options.label: B
options.text: They can increase the maximum bound of the SQL endpoint’s scaling range.

options.label: C
options.text: They can turn on the Auto Stop feature for the SQL endpoint.

options.label: D
options.text: They can turn on the Serverless feature for the SQL endpoint.

text: A new data engineering team team has been assigned to an ELT project. The new data engineering team will need full privileges on the table sales to fully manage the project. Which command can be used to grant full permissions on the database to the new data engineering team?

options.label: A
options.text: GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON TABLE sales TO team;

options.label: B
options.text: GRANT SELECT CREATE MODIFY ON TABLE sales TO team;

options.label: C
options.text: GRANT SELECT ON TABLE sales TO team;

options.label: D
options.text: GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON TABLE team TO sales;

text: In a healthcare provider organization using Delta Lake to store electronic health records (EHRs), a data analyst needs to analyze a snapshot of the patient_records table from two weeks ago before some recent data corrections were applied. What approach should the Data Engineer take to allow the analyst to query that speci�c prior version?

options.label: A
options.text: Truncate the table to remove all data, then reload the data from two weeks ago into the truncated table for the analyst to query.

options.label: B
options.text: Identify the version number corresponding to two weeks ago from the Delta transaction log, share that version number with the analyst to query using VERSION AS OF syntax, or export that version to a new Delta table for the analyst to query.

options.label: C
options.text: Restore the table to the version from two weeks ago using the RESTORE command, and have the analyst query the restored table.

options.label: D
options.text: Use the VACUUM command to remove all versions of the table older than two weeks, then the analyst can query the remaining version.

text: A data engineer has con�gured a Structured Streaming job to read from a table, manipulate the data, and then perform a streaming write into a new table. The code block used by the data engineer is below: The data engineer only wants the query to process all of the available data in as many batches as required. Which line of code should the data engineer use to �ll in the blank?

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: trigger(continuous= “once”)

options.label: D
options.text: trigger(once=True)

text: Data engineer and data analysts are working together on a data pipeline. The data engineer is working on the raw, bronze, and silver layers of the pipeline using Python, and the data analyst is working on the gold layer of the pipeline using SQL. The raw source of the pipeline is a streaming input. They now want to migrate their pipeline to use Delta Live Tables. Which of the following changes will need to be made to the pipeline when migrating to Delta Live Tables?

options.label: A
options.text: The pipeline can have different notebook sources in SQL & Python

options.label: B
options.text: The pipeline will need to be written entirely in SQL

options.label: C
options.text: The pipeline will need to use a batch source in place of a streaming source

options.label: D
options.text: The pipeline will need to be written entirely in Python

text: Identify the impact of ON VIOLATION DROP ROW and ON VIOLATION FAIL UPDATE for a constraint violation. A data engineer has created an ETL pipeline using Delta Live table to manage their company travel reimbursement detail, they want to ensure that the if the location details has not been provided by the employee, the pipeline needs to be terminated. How can the scenario be implemented?

options.label: A
options.text: CONSTRAINT valid_location EXPECT (location = NULL)

options.label: B
options.text: CONSTRAINT valid_location EXPECT (location != NULL) ON VIOLATION FAIL UPDATE

options.label: C
options.text: CONSTRAINT valid_location EXPECT (location != NULL) ON DROP ROW

options.label: D
options.text: CONSTRAINT valid_location EXPECT (location != NULL) ON VIOLATION FAIL

text: Which two conditions are applicable for governance in Databricks Unity Catalog? (Choose two.)

options.label: A
options.text: You can have more than 1 metastore within a databricks account console but only 1 per region.

options.label: B
options.text: Both catalog and schema must have a managed location in Unity Catalog provided metastore is not associated with a location

options.label: C
options.text: You can have multiple catalogs within metastore and 1 catalog can be associated with multiple metastore

options.label: D
options.text: If catalog is not associated with location, it’s mandatory to associate schema with managed locations

options.label: E
options.text: If metastore is not associated with location, it’s mandatory to associate catalog with managed locations
